{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with fever, headache, and neck stiffness, which are common symptoms of meningitis. The CSF analysis shows elevated protein, increased intracranial tension (ICT), and increased white blood cell count (WBC), predominantly lymphocytes, which are also indicative of meningitis. However, the glucose level is within the normal range. Among the options, TB, N. Gonorrhea, and Cryptococcus can cause meningitis. However, TB and Cryptococcus meningitis usually present with low glucose levels in the CSF, which is not the case here. N. Gonorrhea, on the other hand, can cause meningitis with normal glucose levels in the CSF.", "answer_choice": "B. N. Gonorrhea"}
